intro: Corydalis caucasica subsp. caucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian Corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the Caucasus region, including parts of Turkey, Georgia, and Russia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. It produces small, kidney-shaped seeds and has a fibrous root system. Corydalis caucasica subsp. caucasica is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
